## Introdction

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(knitr)
opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, message = F,
               warning = F, device = "png", dpi = 96, type = "cairo")
```

```{r Preamble}
library(tidyverse) # Wrangling and ggplot
# library(readxl) # excel-import
library(ggsci) # color palettes for journals
library(scales) # more scales and color options
library(ggfortify) # principal component plots
library(shiny)
```

# Data Import

```{r, echo=F}
fileInput("file", "Input file (long format)", multiple = F, accept = c(".csv"))
```


```{r}

raw_data <- reactive({
    read_csv(input$file$datapath)
})

renderTable({
    head(raw_data())
})
```

# Data preparation

```{r}
visual_data <- reactive({
    visual_data <- raw_data() %>%
        separate(secondary_name, into = c("type", "special", "replicate"), sep = "_", extra = "merge")
    
    visual_data <- visual_data %>%
        mutate(
            replicate = if_else(type == "WT", special, replicate),
            special = NA_character_
        )
    return(visual_data)
})
```

# Visualisation

Because everything is better with a pretty graph.

```{r}
renderTable({
    visual_data() %>% head()
})


renderPlot({
    by_class_sum <- visual_data() %>%
        group_by(class, type, special, replicate) %>% 
        summarise(
            nmolar = sum(nmolar)
        )
    
    by_type_mean <- by_class_sum %>%
        group_by(class, type) %>% 
        summarise(
            SD = sd(nmolar),
            nmolar = mean(nmolar)
        )
    
    by_type_mean %>% 
        ggplot() +
        aes(x = class, y = nmolar,
            fill = type,
            ymin = nmolar - SD,
            ymax = nmolar + SD) +
        geom_col(position = position_dodge(.9)) +
        geom_errorbar(position = position_dodge(0.9)) +
        theme_classic() +
        theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
              legend.position = c(1,1), legend.justification = c(1,1)) +
        labs(y = "Concentration in nmol",
             x = "Lipid class") +
        scale_fill_nejm()
})
```

Or maybe you want a species profile, say for PCs:

```{r PC_profile, fig.width = 16}
renderPlot({
    
    PC_data <-
        visual_data() %>%
        filter(class == "PC") %>% 
        group_by(lipid, type) %>% 
        summarize(
            SD = sd(nmolar),
            nmolar = mean(nmolar)
        ) %>% 
        filter(
            nmolar > 0.1
        )
    
    PC_data %>% 
        ggplot() +
        aes(x = lipid, y = nmolar,
            fill = type,
            ymin = nmolar - SD,
            ymax = nmolar + SD) +
        geom_col(position = position_dodge(.9)) +
        geom_errorbar(position = position_dodge(0.9)) +
        theme_classic() +
        theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
              legend.position = c(1,1), legend.justification = c(1,1)) +
        labs(y = "Concentration in nmol",
             x = "Lipid") +
        scale_fill_nejm()
    
})
```

## Loop for all species

Or all species profiles.

```{r eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
for (i in unique(visual_data$class)){
    class_data <-
        visual_data %>%
        filter(class == i) %>% 
        group_by(lipid, type) %>% 
        summarize(
            SD = sd(nmolar),
            nmolar = mean(nmolar)
        )
    
    class_plot <- class_data %>% 
        ggplot() +
        aes(x = lipid, y = nmolar,
            fill = type,
            ymin = nmolar - SD,
            ymax = nmolar + SD) +
        geom_col(position = position_dodge(.9)) +
        geom_errorbar(position = position_dodge(0.9)) +
        theme_classic() +
        theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
              legend.position = c(1,1), legend.justification = c(1,1)) +
        labs(y = "Concentration in nmol",
             x = "Lipid") +
        scale_fill_nejm()
    
    ggsave(filename = paste0(i, "_profile.png"),
           plot = class_plot,
           path = params$output_folder,
           device = "png")
}
```
